moves.1. e4: Lately I have watched dmisra with a few exciting games starting with king's gambit. Although my impression is that the output of a game like this is often determined by mistakes, I have decided to try a few myself. I think this is the first I have succeded.
moves.1... e5 2. f4 exf4: few can resist the temptation of a free pawn.
moves.5... Bb4+: I think this was his main mistake
moves.6. c3 Be6: Good move. I thought at this point that I would carry out with the usual "kill all" game.
moves.8... g5: But than, instead of preparing a queen side castle, he wide opened his king's side.
moves.9... Nf6: Hope? Despair? I didn't understand this move.
moves.10. Nxg5: Proceed with my plan, except that I didn't think at the sacrifice anymore.
moves.10... d5: Another help from him. What would I have done if he would have chosed to brink out his knight?
moves.11. e5 Nfd7: Well, the knight is there alright, but not the right one.
